name: Excel Range References
description: For Excel: Find Range References in formulas. Includes: External full refs, file refs, absolute, relative, etc. Note: I did not test R1C1 notation.
content:
=Sheet1!BJ9 + Sheet2!B2
=Sheet1!BJ9 + Sheet2!B2
=Sheet1!BJ9 + Sheet2!B2
=Sheet1!BJ9 + Sheet2!B2
=IF(J4="UL",AE4+AF4,"")
=function('Sheet 2'!$AW$2:$AW$1489, $B4 )
=+'L:\path1\p2\test\2015\more\again\[Testfile.xlsx]Da bomb'!D46
=+'L:\path1\p2\test\2015\more\again\[Testfile.xls]Da bomb'!D46
=+'L:\path1\p2\test\2015\more\again\[Testfile.xlsm]Da bomb'!D46
='[Testfile.xlsm]Da bomb'!D46
author: McCroden
